spirit:abstractionDefinition.spirit:name: LTI_rtl

spirit:port.spirit:description: Global clock signal. Other signals that are not defined as asynchronous are sampled on the rising edge of CLK.

Clock enable signal. Used as a qualifier for the CLK signal. This signal indicates which rising edges of CLK should be acted upon: 1 = valid rising edge of CLK, 0 = any rising edge of CLK should be ignored and no bus-state altered.
Global reset signal. This signal is active LOW.
Indicates whether SMMU translation is required.
Protected Mode attribute for the Non-secure transaction.
Indicates whether LAPAS carries a meaningful PAS.
Indicates the PAS in the translation request.
Identifies an access as Unprivileged or Privileged.
Indicates whether this is an data access or an instruction access.
Indicates the type of the transaction that the LTI request is translating.
Indicates the location to access in the TLB.
Indicates an identify translation is required.
Check signal for LASSID and LASSIDV.
Check signal for LAFLOW, LAPRIV, LAINST and LAIDENT.
Check signal for LAMMUV and LAOGV.
Check signal for LATRANS and LAATTR.
Indicates the PAS in the translated transaction.
Indicates the aligned range of addresses that this translation is valid for.
Check signal for LRATTR and LRHWATTR.
Implementation defined additional signaling. Width is LTI_LCUSER_WIDTH.
Implementation defined additional signaling. Width is LTI_LTUSER_WIDTH.
Request to open the interface or keep it open.

spirit:abstractionDefinition.spirit:description: This bus describes the Local Translation Interface protocol, which can be used to connect to an SMMUv3 translation device. Reference: Arm AMBA Local Translation Interface (LTI) Protocol Specification, Issue D, http://www.arm.com/support/AMBA.html

arm:channel.arm:name: Request
arm:channel.arm:label: LA
arm:channel.arm:description: The Request channel carries all the required information for a translation request.

arm:channel.arm:name: Response
arm:channel.arm:label: LR
arm:channel.arm:description: The Response channel information of a translation.

arm:channel.arm:name: Completion
arm:channel.arm:label: LC
arm:channel.arm:description: The Completion channel carries all the information for a complete a translation request.

arm:channel.arm:name: Tag
arm:channel.arm:label: LT
arm:channel.arm:description: The Tag channel carries all the information to invalidate the translation caches.

arm:channel.arm:name: Interface_Management
arm:channel.arm:label: LM
arm:channel.arm:description: The Interface Management channel controls the interface connection state between Manager and Subordinate.
